content.description: Start on a big jug undercling and throw up to a beautifully sculpted sharp pocket. From there work your way up and to the right on a spicy topout. Be sure to bring some grit to this one.
content.protection: Lots and lots of pads. But if you’re ballsy 1 or 2 should do.
content.location: Walk down the cliffside until you see a big jutting out overhanging lip, the start is directly below that.

content.description: Start on a crappy left hand pinch and a good right hand crimp. From there work your way to the right up to some powerful moves near the top. Finish on the lip near the top. Haven’t cleaned the topout yet.
content.location: Further down the cliff to the right from Wheaties in the Wheat Field. Again this area should appear a lot cleaner than the rest of the cliff.

content.description: 250 ft long limestone cliffside with beautiful shaped holds. Some of the rock is even fossiliferous limestone, some of the rarest I’ve seen in Kansas.
